Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory57.jpg'}
{3: 'The White King has not been able to move all this time, while the Black Bishop on E7 will get checkmate in two moves.'}
{3: 'The two players can both see where the game is going.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'John', 3: "We both know how this ends, don't we?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'John', 3: 'If you had sacrificed your pawns, this would have ended even quicker.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'John', 3: "You're a Construct. I think you could have calculated how best to make your moves.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "But that wouldn't be my judgment.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'To machines, this is simply deduction and calculation based on objective facts, with no emotions and moral considerations involved.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'But I am no machine.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I make my own assessment of the situation, and I make my own choices based on my judgment.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'John', 3: "Do you think I'll agree with you just because you've won a game of chess?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I believe... there is no meaningless victory.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'His father has never told him what happens after becoming a Smith.'}
{3: "Or, perhaps, his father has told him about the end of a Smith's journey from the very beginning."}
{3: 'Become a Smith, then find the next Smith to inherit everything. An endless cycle.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "But I'm not trying to become a Smith.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "I'm going to surpass it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I\'ll use "Smith" to become "Chrome".', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Not abandoning his past. Not denying it, either.'}
{3: 'Langston Smith, Chief of class, Construct, Strike Hawk Captainâ€”'}
{3: 'They are all necessary for him to become "Chrome".'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'The war will be over one day.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'When that happens, Constructs and humans will share the world we reclaim together.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I asked you what a "perfect being" was when you first told me a Smith\'s duty.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "I still can't give you a concrete answer right now, but I will build the bridge that leads us there.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Therefore... this is what I choose in the end.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "I've never considered undoing my identity as a Construct. Not now, not ever.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'John', 3: 'You will face unimaginable difficulties and hurdles.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'John', 3: 'The path you are taking will take you to an endless pit. It will devour you until there is nothing left.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'John', 3: 'Your fight will not stop even when you leave the battlefield. Do you understand what it means?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'You taught me that a Smith does not fear hardship. We excel in them.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'And Chrome from Strike Hawk does not enter a fight without proper preparations.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "I'm your son, Dad.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'John', 3: 'The specialized frame Asimov is working on has only worked on a Construct on Gray Raven so far.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'John', 3: 'To adapt to that frame, that Construct paid a hefty price.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'John', 3: "If you can adapt to this specialized frame with no complications, I'll approve of your choice. I'll stop interfering with your decisions after that as well.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'John', 3: "But if you can't even take on a new frame, then every word you just said is hollow.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I understand. I do not plan to fail.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I will use this frame to demonstrate my determination and what I can achieve.', 4: '1'}
{3: "After a while, John moves his eyes from Chrome's resolute expression back to the paused game on the chessboard."}
{3: 'Like how Chrome picked up the projection of a piece before, John picks up the Queen on A8 and moves it to H8.'}
{3: 'Completely out of the way of the Black Bishop.'}
{3: 'With no more threats, the Black side will easily take the game.'}
{3: 'There is an extra hint of surprise in the way Chrome looks at John. He shifts his eyes back to the board, concealing his feelings.'}
{3: 'He lifts his hand and moves the chess piece. Black Bishop moves to H8.'}
{3: 'Checkmate.'}
{3: 'Chrome stands up from his chair and bows to the man sitting opposite him.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Thank you for your lesson, Dad.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'John stares at the ended game for a long time, lost in thought.'}
{3: 'For a second there, his tensed shoulders seem to have slightly relaxed.'}
